DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST) Total Bilirubin (TBL) Upper Limit of Normal Result Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions that are related to the top value range for alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) and total bilirubin (TBL) outcome as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Alanine Aminotransferase Measurement Aspartate Aminotransferase Measurement Total Bilirubin Measurement Upper Limit of Normal Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A quantitative measurement of alanine aminotransferase present in a sample._A quantitative measurement of aspartate aminotransferase present in a sample._The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test._The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Alanine Aminotransferase Measurement Aspartate Aminotransferase Measurement Total Bilirubin Measurement Upper Limit of Normal Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: A quantitative measurement of alanine aminotransferase present in a sample.:A quantitative measurement of aspartate aminotransferase present in a sample.:The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test.:The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A quantitative measurement of alanine aminotransferase present in a sample.
A quantitative measurement of aspartate aminotransferase present in a sample.

The measurement of the total amount of bilirubin present in a particular substrate. The substrate most often tested is blood, but other fluids extracted from the body may be used periodically depending on the purpose of the test.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are pre-study alanine aminotr
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) less than or equal to 2.5 x the institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) with total bilirubin (TBL) less than or equal to 1 x ULN OR Total bilirubin (TBL) greater than ULN and less than or equal to 1.5 × ULN with ALT and AST less than or equal to 1x ULN?
